Refund.name: Refund
Refund.description: Represents a refund made against a payment.

AccountId.description: The customer account containing the payment that this refund targets.

Balance.description: Remaining balance following refund line applications. Equal to the Amount field – the Net Applied field.

CancellationDate.description: The date that the refund was canceled. This is a required parameter for void services.

CancellationEffectiveDate.description: The date that the cancellation of this refund takes effect.

CancellationGatewayDate.description: The date when the cancellation transaction was processed in the payment gateway.

CancellationGatewayRefNumber.description: Unique ID for the cancellation transaction. Generated by the payment gateway.

CancellationGatewayResultCode.description: Gateway-specific result code for the cancellation transaction. Generated by the payment gateway. Must be mapped to a Salesforce-specific result code.

CancellationSfResultCode.description: Salesforce-specific result code that can map to one or more gateway result codes. We recommend configuring the payment gateway adapter layer to map gateway result codes to the appropriate Salesforce result code.

ClientContext.description: Contains caller context for payment APIs. Useful for re-establishing context during an asynchronous payment transaction.

Comments.description: Users can add comments to provide additional details about a record. Maximum of 1000 characters.

CurrencyIsoCode.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code associated with the payment group record.

Date.description: The date and time that this refund was created.

EffectiveDate.description: Defines the date and time when the refund application becomes effective.

Email.description: Email address of the person who initiated the refund.

GatewayDate.description: The date that a successful gateway communication caused the creation of this refund.

GatewayRefNumber.description: Unique transaction ID created by the payment gateway.

GatewayResultCode.description: Gateway-specific result code. Must be mapped to a Salesforce-specific result code.

GatewayResultCodeDescription.description: Description of the GatewayResultCode. Useful for providing additional context as to why the gateway returned a specific result code.

ImpactAmount.description: Shows the refund’s financial impact against the customer’s accounts receivable. If the refund amount is valid, it equals the Amount field. Equals 0 when the refund amount is void. Has a null value when the refund is canceled.

IpAddress.description: The IP address of the person who initiated the payment.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record can have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed.

MacAddress.description: The MAC address of the person who initiated the refund.

NetApplied.description: Equals the Total Applied field minus the Total Unapplied field.

OrderPaymentSummaryId.description: Order payment summary record that shows the balances of each authorization, capture, and refund made against an order.

PaymentGatewayId.description: The payment gateway used to process this refund.

PaymentGroupId.description: The payment group for the payment being refunded.

PaymentIntentID.description: ID of the payment intent record.

PaymentMethodId.description: The payment method used to create the payment being refunded.

Phone.description: Phone number of the customer who initiated the refund.

ProcessingMode.description: Defines whether the payment has been made outside of the payment platform.

RefundNumber.description: System-created unique ID for this refund.

SfResultCode.description: Salesforce-specific result code that can map to one or more gateway result codes. We recommend configuring the payment gateway adapter layer to map gateway result codes to the appropriate Salesforce result code.

Status.description: Defines the state of this refund.

TotalApplied.description: The sum of Amount fields across all of this refund’s applied refund lines.

TotalUnapplied.description: The sum of Amount fields across all of this refund’s unapplied refund lines.

Type.description: Defines how this refund is used.
